description: Freelance Illustrator, Graphic Designer and Webdesigner. Co-designer of the zenphoto site and responsible for the German translation. Originally developed Zenpage - A CMS plugin for Zenphoto.

Graduate from University of Missouri. Coldfusion Developer, Web-designer (www.career.umkc.edu). Mark helps with various things like producing the videos for the site, co-designing the ZP website, moderating on the forums, testing, and general advice. Also Mark was responsible of keeping Zenphoto alive with maintaining the so called "community build" (which became the base of Zenphoto 1.1 later) in 2007 while it's developement and future was on hold for some time.
Bharat is the lead developer of the Gallery Project and provided fixes for the Exifer libary which Gallery uses and Zenphoto maintains since 2005.
Media designer from Santiago, Chile
Systems Administrator
author_pim_rijpsma
Systems Administrator/IT Support/Network Administrator/Web Developer, Radiologic Technologist Student Developer of the Akismet Hack.
Software developer, Hong Kong Zenphoto: fatmangallery.com
Originally created the Exifer library and maintained it until in 2005 the Zenphotp project incorporated it and took over development.
Student, ENSIIE, a French postgraduate school in computer science.
Besides moderating on the forum he provided the Imagick graphics library support for Zenphoto 1.3 and several bugfix patches.

Student in Computer Science at the ENIB (www.enib.fr), Founder of Lookiad, a "junior company" working on web development and design. Original developer of ZenVideo, the first Zenphoto video tool support
Programmer, System Administrator, Web Developer, Usability Advisor, University of Washington. Geospatial Patch for ZenPhoto (Trac#78).
User experience/user interface, Buenos Aires, Argentina
Software developer (Java, PHP, Ruby)

Joen created the very first Zenphoto theme, the still in use default theme, for Zenphoto 1.0 He also was co-author with Tristan Harward of the first backend layout whose base of using tabs is also still in use.

Retired. Graduate from Yale in 1966. 35 years in software development in all sorts of roles, including Director of Operating Systems development at the Unisys (nee Burroughs) facility in Mission Viejo, CA. and former primary implementer of the Burroughs Master Control Program for the Burroughs mainframe computers. Author and publisher of a number of Shareware, Freeware, and commercial software packages including: Printographer for the Apple II and the GUI front end for QuadToneRIP, a B&W printing RIP
B.Sc. in Biology; Co-developer of the "thinkdreams" theme with Craig. Implemented slideshow, fotobuzz
Network Administrator, Exactech, Inc. (http://www.exac.com)

BA/CompSci from UC Berkeley, Lead programmer, Silvertip Labs Inc. Founder and lead developer of Zenphoto for 3 years. Designed the core software, the "Testing" theme, the "Tricasa" theme with Javascript preloading, and more.
Broadcast Engineer
